title: SKGLView on .NET MAUI is missing a handler
body:
I can’t use SKGLView because its handler is missing. SKCanvasView works fine.

```csharp
new SKGLView();
```

**Expected Behavior**

A working OpenGL view.

**Actual Behavior**

Runtime error saying no handler found.

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  latest
- Last known good version:  none 
- IDE:  VSMPreview
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - macCatalyst:
- Target Devices:
  - Mac

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Yeah... Seems the iOS team deleted that. There is no GL view for mac cat. Not sure what to do. Might need to use metal, but this is slightly different.

comments.author: charlesroddie
comments.body:
Agreed the SkGpuView is a good idea.

On the subject of ios/maccatalyst naming, ios seems to include maccatalyst which is a bit confusing. Perhaps SkiaSharp.Views.Uikit would be more accurate.

Currently this is regulated by:
https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/b8efe44ae79614d7c0c0739e7144427912fd166a/source/SkiaSharp.Views/SkiaSharp.Views.Apple/SKMetalView.cs#L18
```
#if __IOS__
namespace SkiaSharp.Views.iOS
#elif __MACOS__
namespace SkiaSharp.Views.Mac
#endif
```
And catalyst seems to be _IOS_. For example https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/b8efe44ae79614d7c0c0739e7144427912fd166a/samples/Gallery/Uno.WinUI/SkiaSharpSample.Mobile/SkiaSharpSample.Mobile.csproj#L33

```
<PropertyGroup Condition="'$(TargetFramework)'=='net6.0-ios' or '$(TargetFramework)'=='net6.0-maccatalyst'">
```
